appearances.title: The Last Word With Lawrence O'Donnell : MSNOW : January 9, 2026 7:00pm-8:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: our bill, mine and joaquin castro's bill essentially is talking about taxpayer subsidies to essentiallyare system or running their oil exploitation system. we don't want any part of that. i can tell you, i have not yet met a single person who said, yeah, it's a good idea to go and engage in another iraq or afghanistan style occupation of venezuela instead of focusing on the pressing economic problems at home. today, i was at a child care facility where i met a working mom who's about to have her child care assistance cut off by the trump administration in an illegal freeze, by the way, which will make it harder for her to work if she doesn't have that assistance. and so she's facing an affordability crisis with regard to child care, just as others are facing a tremendous affordability crisis with regard to groceries, rent, health care or education. and that is what we need to be focused on right now. >> well, given all those things you just said, what concerns you most about trump tying u.s. foreign policy to oil production, especially when americans are struggling with high costs here

appearances.title: CNN News Central : CNNW : January 7, 2026 12:00pm-1:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: let's talk with democratic congressman joaquin castro of texas. you've seen these videos. we have to be clear. we don't know what happens before the video of the shooting. we haven't seen that part. you've heard what dhs secretary noem has said. you've heard what local and state officials are saying. what are your questions right now, as you are hearing this information? >> well, i mean, what i have seen is the video and all americans should watch that video, and it doesn't look like that ice officer is in danger from this woman that was driving the car. and it looks like he shot her unnecessarily and killed her. and under donald trump, ice has become a rogue agency. it's. you've got a dhs secretary who's unqualified for the job. ice has been caught lying. and a judge a few months ago wrote over 200 page order talking about that. they've been lying about who they've deported, where they've deported people to, who they've arrested, how long they've detained people. and so this is an organization that really doesn't have much credibility anymore and is abusing communities, i

appearances.title: Way Too Early With Ali Vitali : MSNOW : January 9, 2026 2:00am-3:00am PST
appearances.snippet: lawmakers like like joaquin castro came on yesterday saying, this is the least transparent administrationan, what does that tell you about where we are right now? >> so, ali, i think back to my time in iraq. i went in with the infiltration with the special operations forces. there was, again, a lot of euphoria. if you remember, people were very excited about this. i think 70% of the american public thought this was the right thing. we thought we were actually making progress. and then it was very clear there was no day after plan. and i remember the cia having arguments with then the coalition provisional authority. this was paul bremer and the idea of de-baathification and all the things that the bush administration at the time did, which certainly did not seem to be the right move. and so i think we're seeing this again. again, tactical brilliance, then strategic incompetence and dysfunction and congress remembers. >> yeah. congress remembers. and also the way the administration is trying to say, we're not building this plan on the fly. and yet they're also not being transparent about w

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 8, 2026 2:30pm-6:31pm EST
appearances.snippet: and at this point, i would like to turn to congressman joaquin castro, who's the ranking member of the house foreign affairs committee, western hemisphere subcommittee, for his remarks. thank you. ranking member mcgovern. less than a week ago, president trump initially it an unconstitutional and illegal invasion of venezuela. it's a war that the american people did not ask for and cannot afford this month. millions of americans are either losing their health care coverage or seeing their premiums spike. for me, as a cancer patient, the cost of my health care coverage went up 20 $400 this year. $200 more a month. there's a shot that i have to take every month because of my cancer that costs more than $20,000 per injection. and every month i sit in the waiting room at the mais cancer center in san antonio, texas, with other people. and i wonder how many of those folks are barely able to afford their health care coverage or how many may be losing it because of spending billions of dollars on things like war rather than billions of dollars here at home to make sure that health care is more
